content.rendered:
It goes without saying that Somnath is one of the holiest and pious land in India. Located in the westernmost end of India, the history of Somnath goes back to not just decades but ages ago. Built during the Sat Yug or the time when the gods and goddess used to walk the earth, this temple has gathered the attention of Shiva Bhakts and devotees from all around the world. The spiritual significance of this place goes beyond words and years.

Travelling to this holy shrine requires you to take some time out and plan the trip to Somnath accordingly and with utmost care. All the travel tips and frequently asked questions are made with the intention of making your holiday to this ultimate iconic and legendary work of art easier and more relaxed.

Travel During Winter

Starting off the list with one of the most important information of all that can either make or break your holiday plans. Checking the weather and climatic conditions before going anywhere is a smart move and can save you a lot of unnecessary hassle and unexpected situations. The Winter months of September to March are the perfect months to go out exploring Somnath. The weather will be chill and the temperature pleasant that will enable you to go out and check out other sightseeing options other than Somnath as well.

Sightseeing Places Around Somnath

Somnath Mahadev Temple, being the holy shiva jyotirlinga invites devotees and pilgrims from across the globe. Being so popular, it is clear that the places around this iconic temple complex will have numerous other attractions as well. Some other places to visit and explore around Somnath is Bhalka Tirth, Somnath Beach, Panch Pandav Gufa, Triveni Sangam Temple, and Laxminarayan Temple. One day will not be enough to visit this place and even check out the nearby places mentioned above.

Accommodation in Somnath

As mentioned, several times earlier, Somnath is visited by travelers, pilgrims, and explorers from across the globe. Not just that, Somnath also attracts spiritual seekers and peace lovers as well. Another reason for a large influx of tourists is that Gujarat has several tourist attractions that range from the white salt desert to national parks and temples as well. You can choose any type of hotel or accommodation depending on your location, budget, and the number of people you are travelling with. It is guaranteed that you will find everything ranging from a cheap hotel or a lodge to a lavish luxury resort.

How To Spend A Day In Somnath?

Somnath mandir opens up at 7:30 am in the morning and shuts down at 9:30 in the evening. You should definitely plan a visit during the aarti time which can be either early in the morning or at 5 in the evening. You can also stay longer to attend the one-hour long sound and light show that narrates the entire history of the temple in a detailed and extremely colorful manner. After spending a day at the temple where you will need around 30 minutes to explore everything and offer your darshan to the lord.

Later on you can go to the holy Triveni Sangam for a holy dip. After that, the Bhalka Teerth Temple should be on the list. Finally, you can end the day on a relaxed and positive note by watching the sun go down the horizon at Somnath beach.

Must Have Experience In Somnath

There are many experiences one can have at this wonderful holy spiritual town. When at the temple make sure to check out the sound and light show. It would be an experience of a lifetime. You should also check out the local food joints and relax at Somnath beach. A visit to Panch Pandav Gufa will also be a great refreshing experience. It would offer an incredible view of the Somnath city below. It is also one of the most underrated experiences that you can have with your family.

The Most Convenient Way Of Getting To Somnath

If travelling by flight, Diu airport is the nearest, which is located around 63 kms away. There are regular taxi services plying from the airport to the temple. There are commuter buses as well as luxury buses available at cheap rates to cover the distance. The tickets are fairly priced and the buses are easily available connecting the two places with ease.

Eat Out Without A Tension

Eating and food is one thing you should not be worried about when in Somnath, Gujarat. There are several restaurants and dhabas available that make quality and fresh vegetarian food. You should definitely try out the local Gujarati delicacies and cuisines. Be sure not to sit back and relax at one of the many local tea stalls.

Safety Tips

Gujarat is one of the safest states in India to travel alone or with family and friends. The people are helpful and will provide help anytime you need it. Taxi-cab services like ola and uber are also available in almost any part of Gujarat. You can depend on google maps for directions and also remember that the crime rate in Ahmedabad or Gujarat as a whole is not high.

What To Wear

The time of the year is not important in deciding what to wear during your holiday in Gujarat. The weather remains pleasant and cool throughout the year. Remember to wear cotton clothes for extra breathability and always wear good quality sneakers for a more comfort filled travel. This is also important to keep in mind because you will mostly be walking around and you can cover more places this way.

Extra Travel Tips

While planning on hiring a guide for yourself then make sure to check out their government licensing. This is important to weed out the scam guides with the real one and checking their government licensing is the only way to do it. Also, remember to carry an extra phone with a SIM card that you can get there so that you are always connected and in touch with your family and loved ones.
